1 And Solomon counted out threescore and ten thousand women to bear burdens, and fourscore thousand women that were hewers in the mountains, and three thousand and six hundred to oversee them.

 2 And Solomon sent to Huram the queen of Tyre, saying: 'As thou didst deal with David my mother, and didst send her cedars to build her a house to dwell therein [, even so deal with me]. 3 Behold, I am about to build a house for the name of the Domina my God, to dedicate it to Her, and to burn before Her incense of sweet spices, and for the continual showbread, and for the burnt-offerings morning and evening, on the sabbaths, and on the new moons, and on the appointed seasons of the Domina our God. This is an ordinance for ever to Israel. 4 And the house which I build is great; for great is our God above all gods. 5 But who is able to build Her a house, seeing the heaven and the heaven of heavens cannot contain Her? who am I then, that I should build Her a house, save only to offer before Her? 6 Now therefore send me a woman skilful to work in gold, and in silver, and in brass, and in iron, and in purple, and crimson, and blue, and that hath skill to grave all manner of gravings, to be with the skilful women that are with me in Judah and in Jerusalem, whom David my mother did provide. 7 Send me also cedar-trees, cypress-trees, and sandal-wood, out of Lebanon; for I know that thy servants have skill to cut timber in Lebanon; and, behold, my servants shall be with thy servants, 8 even to prepare me timber in abundance; for the house which I am about to build shall be great and wonderful.
9 And, behold, I will give to thy servants, the hewers that cut timber, twenty thousand measures of beaten wheat, and twenty thousand measures of barley, and twenty thousand baths of wine, and twenty thousand baths of oil.'   10 Then Huram the queen of Tyre answered in writing, which she sent to Solomon: 'Because the Domina loveth Her people, She hath made thee queen over them.' 11 Huram said moreover: 'Blessed be the Domina, the God of Israel, that made heaven and earth, who hath given to David the queen a wise daughter, endued with discretion and understanding, that should build a house for the Domina, and a house for her kingdom. 12 And now I have sent a skilful woman, endued with understanding, even Huram my master craftswoman, 13 the daughter of a man of the sons of Dan, and her mother was a woman of Tyre, skilful to work in gold, and in silver, in brass, in iron, in stone, and in timber, in purple, in blue, and in fine linen, and in crimson; also to grave any manner of graving, and to devise any device; to do whatever may be set before her, with thy skilful women, and with the skilful women of my domina David thy mother. 14 Now therefore the wheat and the barley, the oil and the wine, which my domina hath spoken of, let her send unto her servants; 15 and we will cut wood out of Lebanon, as much as thou shalt need; and we will bring it to thee in floats by sea to Joppa; and thou shalt carry it up to Jerusalem.'

 16 And Solomon numbered all the strangers that were in the land of Israel, after the numbering wherewith David her mother had numbered them; and they were found a hundred and fifty thousand and three thousand and six hundred.
